📊 Executive Summary

This proposal details the design and implementation of a Blockchain-based Consent Management System for Electronic Health Records (EHR). The revolutionary system ensures patients are the primary custodians of their health data, while authorized entities (Doctors, Hospitals, Insurance Providers, and Government Regulators) can access records only with explicit patient consent.

🔐 Patient Data Ownership

Patients maintain complete control over their medical records with blockchain-verified consent management.

🔌 Plug-and-Play Integration

Seamless integration with existing healthcare systems via standardized APIs.

⚖️ Regulatory Compliance

Built-in compliance with HIPAA, GDPR, and other healthcare regulations.

📈 Scalable & Modular

Horizontally scalable architecture that grows with your healthcare organization.

🎯 Project Objectives & Scope

✅ Key Objectives

  • ● Ensure data privacy and patient ownership of records
  • ● Provide role-based dashboards for 5 key stakeholders
  • ● Enable workflow-based consent approvals/rejections
  • ● Offer comprehensive exports and reporting (CSV, Excel)
  • ● Maintain immutability and auditability through blockchain
  • ● Build as plug-and-play module for easy integration

👥 Key Stakeholders

P Patients (Primary data owners)
D Doctors (Care providers)
H Hospitals (Healthcare institutions)
I Insurance Providers
G Government Regulators

✅ In Scope

  • • Blockchain-based consent management (grant/revoke)
  • • Role-based dashboards with export functionality
  • • Smart contracts for identity, consent, and record integrity
  • • Off-chain storage integration for medical files
  • • APIs for integration with existing HIMS
  • • Data import/migration support for healthcare providers

❌ Out of Scope

  • • Licensing, server procurement, or infrastructure costs
  • • Updates to client's existing databases/APIs
  • • Legacy system migration (except voluntary imports)
  • • Hardware procurement and setup
  • • Third-party software licensing

🏗️ High-Level System Architecture

The system follows a modern, layered architecture designed for scalability, security, and maintainability. Each layer has specific responsibilities and communicates through well-defined interfaces.

🎨 UI Layer

  • • Role-based dashboards for all 5 stakeholder types
  • • Intuitive consent workflows (approve/reject interface)
  • • Comprehensive reporting and export system
  • • Responsive design for mobile and desktop access

🔗 API Layer

  • • RESTful APIs for seamless HIMS integration
  • • Robust consent management and authorization
  • • Secure authentication and role-based access control
  • • Bridge between UI, blockchain, and storage systems

⛓️ Blockchain Layer

  • • Decentralized identity registration and management
  • • Immutable consent logging (grant/revoke transactions)
  • • Complete audit trail for regulatory compliance
  • • Smart contracts for automated access validation

💾 Off-Chain Storage

  • • Encrypted storage of medical records and files
  • • Blockchain stores only metadata and file hashes
  • • GDPR-compliant data handling and retention
  • • High-performance access for authorized users

⚡ System Workflows

🔐 Consent Management Workflow

1

Access Request Submission

Healthcare entity submits request via secure API

2

Patient Notification

Real-time notification sent to patient dashboard

3

Patient Decision

Patient reviews and approves/rejects via UI

4

Blockchain Recording

Decision recorded immutably on blockchain

5

Secure Access Granted

If approved, API provides secure access link

📥 Data Onboarding Workflow

1

Import Decision

Hospital/Doctor chooses to import records into HIMS

2

Ownership Transfer

Data ownership automatically transferred to patient identities

3

Integrity Validation

Blockchain validates file hashes and integrity

4

System Integration

Records become available in consent-based system
